details:
There are many languages still without a translation of the Bible.

 Bible translators need a text editor that can input Bible text. Bible
 text is unique in that it is organized in two distinct hierarchies.
 One, it has sections and paragraphs, like any other text. Second, it is
 made up of books that contain chapters that contain verses. Many
 contemporary Bible translators use the USFM data format for their Bible
 translations, but the most widespread USFM text editors require
 Windows. Bibledit-gtk is a multi-platform USFM Bible editor or Scripture
 processor.

 It has been designed for the glory of God and the salvation of people.
